text.section: After proper notice and hearing, the counties and Baltimore City may establish, by ordinance or local law, one or more reserve accounts.
A reserve account is an account or fund in which funds are retained to support appropriations which have become unfunded.

An ordinance or local law establishing a reserve account shall, at a minimum, establish or provide for:
Requirements for the accumulation of a fixed dollar amount or a percentage of designated revenues or both;
The circumstances under which the funds in the account may be used; and
The use of any earnings on the account.
An account created pursuant to this section shall be a continuing, nonlapsing account.
